website_summaries.verdict: With its imagination-stoking robotic figure combined with classic LEGO figures and a challenging build, this fun kit may be a collector’s item soon.
pros: Combines classic LEGO Space figures with an exciting exo-suit model
A 321-piece, challenging build that results in a highly posable robot figure
Instructions are clear and easy to follow, without missing steps
cons: Multiple technical pieces and lots of very small pieces, so it’s not for younger kids unless supervised
Pieces tend to fall off easily, making this better for display than play

customer_reviews.title: One of the coolest lego space sets you can buy! Hands down!
customer_reviews.text: I absolutely love this set! I really wish Lego would create more sets similar to this regarding exo-suits or robots. I purchased this set to create a Brickfilm using the exo-suit and a simple story line but this set has so much more to it. I've found a number of other configurations you can make with the pieces and its just so darn cool looking. I also like that you get two minifigs that are green space figures and not the generic red or blue. I can't recommend this set enough! My boys were fascinated with it and once I created a simple video using the set they were even more jazzed about it.
customer_reviews.author: kingspud

customer_reviews.title: One of the best lego sets I ever bought.
customer_reviews.text: I am so glad I bought this set. This model has reawakened my inner child. The build is fun & challenging. It uses more technic parts instead of traditional lego bricks so it may be harder for younger kids to build. The finished product is highly posable and fun to look at. It comes with 2 classic space mini figures and a robot turtle (also very cool). Buy it before it retires!
customer_reviews.author: tatertots

customer_reviews.title: so cool!  but fragile....
customer_reviews.text: LEGO IDEA sets are awesome and this one is no exception. It is a really clever throwback set to all the old space series LEGO used to have. You can see on the box how awesome it looks! 2 sweet minifigs and an awesome robot turtle!!!! One thing to note though is how fragile this thing is. It uses so many small, gray pieces you will hardly believe you can actually make this set with them, but you can. It looks so cool on display but my little one gets a little frustrated while playing with it cause little pieces will break off. Amazingly cool set from IDEAS, but be careful if you plan to play with it a lot.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: A steal at $35-ish
customer_reviews.text: This is a really incredible Lego set. It's smaller than its part count might suggest but it's shockingly poseable and looks truly impressive. Display value is through the roof. Play value is pretty high although there are some pieces that fall off pretty easily. It contains a lot of high value technic pieces that are sure to come in handy if you decide to disassemble. The green classic space minifigs are sure to hold their value. Like a lot of the new lego sets, this contains spares of a lot of the smaller pieces.
customer_reviews.author: EDG

customer_reviews.title: Did Not Disappoint
customer_reviews.text: This is one of the absolute most enjoyable sets I've purchased. I still have my Classic Space guys from the 80s (SPACESHIP!), which were always my favourite theme. Not only did the designers lovingly revisit the OG era, but they developed a very cool (and simple) set that would a be fun addition to even the most modern of LEGO's space entries.
customer_reviews.author: TJ Searl

customer_reviews.title: Fun, challenging design
customer_reviews.text: Purchased this for my husband's birthday as I'm a fan of the LEGO Ideas line and he enjoys building some of the more unique and harder sets. This is completely made up of lots and lots and lottttssss of small LEGO pieces, so it's definitely not for the younger kids (I can definitely see my 7yo losing pieces while putting it together). The suit poses and stays in place well. There's a lot of detail in this set with all of its smaller pieces - it's rather creative in that aspect. It's about a 30-40 minute build and worth the time and money.
customer_reviews.author: Kelly

customer_reviews.title: The one we were all waiting for!
customer_reviews.text: I am a huge fan of Lego MOCs, and have a bit of a soft spot for mechs and other mechanical like builds. Although all of the Ideas sets are designed by fans, this set in particular feels like a huge shout-out to the mech building community. The Ideas program was a very smart move for Lego to connect with their fans. This set's a bit fragile, but still very poseable. Something I really like is that you're given more than just the exo-suit; you get the cool little rover and another mini-fig as well. Well done Lego!
customer_reviews.author: Intragroove

customer_reviews.title: Fun, posable build!
customer_reviews.text: I love this set. Once built, you can articulate all the joints and pose the suit in nearly infinite configurations. The green minifig suits are a nice color along with the old-school space logo. The build was complex enough to keep me engaged, but not so difficult that it was frustrating. P.S. - the little turtle is super cute too!
customer_reviews.author: K K

customer_reviews.title: Cool, unique set for older kids/teens/adults.
customer_reviews.text: Great Set! Quite detailed and just pretty cool in general. Not too many Lego sets like this around; it definitely shows its MOC (fan creation) origin. A lot of very small pieces, so maybe not the greatest thing for very young kids, but definitely a must for any older kids/teens. Can be put together as a quick rainy afternoon project. Love it for display, but keep in mind that its level of greebling (small pieces that add detail to the figure) makes it quite fragile and prone to piece losses even during short moves. Cool male and female space minifigs add a vital touch to any set piece, plus you gotta have someone to get in the mech!
customer_reviews.author: Julian Acuna

customer_reviews.title: Nice challenging kit with many small parts
customer_reviews.text: Nice challenging kit with many small parts. Construction is mostly axles and pins rather than bricks. The finished model is very posable.
customer_reviews.author: Jasen

customer_reviews.title: Great set for display, less so for play
customer_reviews.text: Great set for any LEGO fans. There are fantastic details throughout the piece. The joints are well-articulated. Many, many small pieces. Most of them attach just fine, but a few pop off if you look at it wrong, it seems like. I really love how it looks on my shelf. Overall a a pretty good value for the money. I dock a half star just for the fairly fragile nature of the completed product, but it looks so good I can't really complain.
customer_reviews.author: Alex Q

customer_reviews.title: Great space set reminiscent of the classic space sets
customer_reviews.text: Really nice LEGO set which is best suited to an older child or adult. LEGO recommends 12+ due to the amount of small pieces and difficulty, but my 10 year old easily put this set together. This set has some very unique figures including a green female astronaut. Reminds me a lot of the classic space sets that I had as a child. Now I can share this experience with my child. Anything to get them off the computer/tablet!!!
customer_reviews.author: Helps2Review

customer_reviews.title: I Spoil Him Sometimes
customer_reviews.text: I honestly didn't expect to see this arrive today. But it did. If I ordered more stuff online, I'd totally get Prime, but I don't so now to the product! I can't say much since this is my boy's Christmas gift. Everything seems order, I know he's going to love it. After all, its been on his wishlist since it came out. But it came with wicked fast shipping, its nice and new. Going to look forward to him opening it up on Christmas.
customer_reviews.author: Gabby

customer_reviews.title: Best Lego set ever
customer_reviews.text: Best Lego set ever! Clearly it's not as involved as the Sidney Opera House or an Imperial Star Destroyer (both of which I've built too) but I truly love this set. I bought an extra one to give my kid someday.
customer_reviews.author: JMLA

customer_reviews.title: This ideas box captures what made that 70's -80's era of space legos great.
customer_reviews.text: This takes me back to my childhood. The original Space Legos were my favorites. This ideas box captures what made that era of space legos good. The detail and intricacy is amazing, but a lot of small part. When put together is works great as a model or a toy, but not so much for younger children. Many small parts
customer_reviews.author: TheoGeekz

customer_reviews.title: looks very cool but comes undone easily
customer_reviews.text: some pieces are not well secured, this seems to be geared more for "display piece" purposes than "play" requiring frequent re-assembly especially of the anteanna and small items.
customer_reviews.author: J. Sam

customer_reviews.title: Challenging, Fun Set For Older Builders
customer_reviews.text: Unique and complex set. Lots of small pieces make this a challenging build for even an experienced LEGO builder. The finished set is very well articulated for great possibility and play value. To me, even though it tries, it misses the mark in marrying with the look of the Classic LEGO Space series, but maybe perhaps succeeds as an evolution of that style.
customer_reviews.author: Phil B.

customer_reviews.title: I primarily purchase Legos to alleviate the stress and responsibility of good parenting but this didn't provide nearly enough "m
customer_reviews.text: This only occupied my child for about 40 minutes. I primarily purchase Legos to alleviate the stress and responsibility of good parenting but this didn't provide nearly enough "me" time. Buy this product cuz as soon as lego stops making it then some middle aged lego nerd on amazon will charge $200 for it.
customer_reviews.author: Mark Flatley

customer_reviews.title: Amazing fun kit for slightly older kids/adults.
customer_reviews.text: I had a ton of fun building this. I would not really give it to a very young kid. This kit has a lot of small pieces and the Mech is very good for posing but cannot truly be played with by a kid, it would fall apart owing to lots of small pieces. I love it, but still, would not give it to very young kids..
customer_reviews.author: sd

customer_reviews.title: Everything is awesome
customer_reviews.text: Awesome. Not for little kids though. A bit too advanced and hard to do for a little kids and too many small parts obviously. It will be inconvenient to finish building it while waiting for your kids to pass those parts they swallowed earlier.
customer_reviews.author: Jin Champloo

customer_reviews.title: My 10 YO son loved it!
customer_reviews.text: What can I say? it is LEGO, and it is spaceships inspired. My 10 YO son has lots of kits, and had no issues putting it together. His favorite feature is that he can mix and match with other parts of other kits, and make his own inventions. Looking at all LEGO sets and their prices, I feel this one was the best combination of price/age group/kit size.
customer_reviews.author: Cecilia Moneta

customer_reviews.title: Wonderfully creative!!!
customer_reviews.text: I very much enjoy the Lego Ideas sets. They are totally unique in the way that you build the model. The robo-turtle is my favorite part of this set though. The Exo-Suit was worth the purchase for the experience but I do not imagine it standing the test of time and play. A great assortment of pieces and mini-figures.
customer_reviews.author: M. Pino

customer_reviews.title: Gotta Luv LEGO
customer_reviews.text: Got the item in great shape, and it is quality LEGO product. No remorse
customer_reviews.author: Monkeybrew

customer_reviews.title: Adding to the astronaut collection
customer_reviews.text: My son loves these but he is a little too small to put them together himself. A perfect opportunity to add some green astronauts to the old 80's space Legos that I handed down to him. Now the red and white 80's characters can play along with the new Benny from Lego Movie and the new Exo greens.
customer_reviews.author: Josh's Dad

customer_reviews.title: Quite a few pieces are loosely held and are very easy to fall off
customer_reviews.text: One of the poorly designed and made lego sets. Quite a few pieces are loosely held and are very easy to fall off. The instructions also have printing errors that the parts you are about to assemble are not what the small pictures are showing
customer_reviews.author: Konsumer

customer_reviews.title: Glad to find this set
customer_reviews.text: Glad to find this set! It is sold out on the Lego website and no local stores had any left.
customer_reviews.author: skye237

customer_reviews.title: My 5 Year Old Loved It!
customer_reviews.text: This is a very cool Lego set. It is a throwback to the Lego Space sets I had as a kid. It does have quite a few small pieces. It seems to be a "special edition" kit. It comes with a cool instruction book, that has a graphic comic in it. From my 5 year old Master Builder... I like it because its a space suit and it looks cool.
customer_reviews.author: Luke

customer_reviews.title: For the Lego junkie in your life!
customer_reviews.text: My 6 year old is a Lego-holic. We call the extra bedroom in the house the "Lego-Lab." He's going through a robot phase and since this one is hard to find, he loved it. Looks wicked cool and came with some extras. Get one before they disappear!
customer_reviews.author: Dr. Bean

customer_reviews.title: Five Stars
customer_reviews.text: Great price for a hard to find and discontinued product
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Love it
customer_reviews.text: Love love love it... IM LOVIN IT!!! Love this lego set great idea whoever made it im gladi bought it
customer_reviews.author: V_Freak_leader

customer_reviews.title: Great model
customer_reviews.text: My son and I love mechs and this one is not only cool looking, it has lots of special pieces for other future projects. Would like a few more for a small squad!
customer_reviews.author: chillausmc

customer_reviews.title: Amazing Looking Lego Set
customer_reviews.text: Looks great, and extremely posable. Lots and lots of tiny pieces... it will take a bit to build and be careful not to loose anything! End result is, well, bad-ass.
customer_reviews.author: Hunsberg

customer_reviews.title: One of the better recent sets
customer_reviews.text: One of the better recent sets. Lots of pieces. Great design and play value. Two rare classic space mini figs. Don't pay more than the normal retail price because lego has been, although painfully too slowly, filling demand.
customer_reviews.author: Stopher

customer_reviews.title: This kit does not disappoint. I love it!!
customer_reviews.text: This is hands down my favorite mech-type build from Lego and easily one of my favorite Lego builds ever.
customer_reviews.author: Alex

customer_reviews.title: Rainy day fun!
customer_reviews.text: My 12 year old gave this a two thumbs up. Not overly complicated but it kept him busy for a couple of hours.
customer_reviews.author: Heather

customer_reviews.title: Excellent set. Though its not made to be a ...
customer_reviews.text: Excellent set. Though its not made to be a playset, it is a great build and well priced for a set this size. Also the only set ever made with green 'Classic Spacemen' ;-) ... I have to add that I loved the booklet and packaging - made the set feel even more special!
customer_reviews.author: Ruben Kremer

customer_reviews.title: Great finished product, Not a fun build
customer_reviews.text: LOTS of little pieces. The build wasn't as fun as hoped however the finished product is amazing and articulate.
customer_reviews.author: Steven Kelley

customer_reviews.title: I want more of these!
customer_reviews.text: I love this kit, and I've made a lot of modifications to the original build and now it's at war in a Time Lord setting with the Daleks!
customer_reviews.author: BMWDawg

customer_reviews.title: Amaxing kit, but not for beginners
customer_reviews.text: Great kit! Loved putting it together. Very difficult though, not recommended for new or inexperienced builders.
customer_reviews.author: John Tuttle

customer_reviews.title: Five Stars
customer_reviews.text: My son loves it, and my other son wants one now. What more can be said?
customer_reviews.author: SWR

customer_reviews.title: Fantastic, detailed build
customer_reviews.text: Fantastic, detailed build, and a great display piece, though it's tricky to pose, meaning it wouldn't be so great to actually play with.
customer_reviews.author: Purchaser

customer_reviews.title: Neat set, but for the older crowd.
customer_reviews.text: Unique set for the Lego collector or adult. This isnt terribly playable unless some modifications are made (online forums have ideas). At the price and scale I'd say no younger than 13.
customer_reviews.author: remy1492

customer_reviews.title: LEGO my LEGO.
customer_reviews.text: Had an absolute blast putting this together. It is more of a 'pose it and forget it' kind of kit. All of the little bits can be pretty finicky.
customer_reviews.author: Bob Rosland

customer_reviews.title: Really cool set.
customer_reviews.text: This set is awesome. Especially since it was designed by a fellow fan. It has a lot of little intricate details, and some really cool building techniques. I dont think it would be really well suited for being played with as it seems pretty delicate, but defintely a great addition to any LEGO fan collection!
customer_reviews.author: Roadliner

customer_reviews.title: Very nice set. Not a lot of pieces
customer_reviews.text: Very nice set. Not a lot of pieces, but a nice build, somewhat complex. Resulting figure is great for display or play.
customer_reviews.author: JR0

customer_reviews.title: Yay Exo-Suit!
customer_reviews.text: This set was designed by a fellow Lego enthusiast, Peter Reid. It's an honor to own a set that he designed.
customer_reviews.author: Scott Bourgeois

customer_reviews.title: Technical and cool
customer_reviews.text: It's a beautiful set. It was actually more time consuming to construct than anticipated as all the pieces are almost the exact same color. Anyway, it's one of my favorite Legos I've owned.
customer_reviews.author: Donald

customer_reviews.title: It's a great set and I'm very happy I bought it
customer_reviews.text: I was so excited when I saw this set be selected as an official lego set. I missed the initial wave at the Lego Stores and bought this one when it was available. It's a great set and I'm very happy I bought it!
customer_reviews.author: Kyle

customer_reviews.title: Cool LEGO Build
customer_reviews.text: My favorite LEGO build so far. It's technically for my 5 year old, and there are a few small decorative parts that constantly fall off when he plays with it, but he still loves it. The green retro astronauts are a nice addition to the collection too.
customer_reviews.author: Mike in NH

customer_reviews.title: This was a fun build and the techniques used were interesting
customer_reviews.text: This was a fun build and the techniques used were interesting. However it felt a lot more like a technic set than a lego set. In fact most of the build is technic based. Not really a bad thing, just something that might be useful information based on preference.
customer_reviews.author: Adam B.

customer_reviews.title: Five Stars
customer_reviews.text: Very creative kid loved to build it. It was easy
customer_reviews.author: Prags

customer_reviews.title: So cool!
customer_reviews.text: AWESOME LEGGO SET! Definitely not a small child's set but after about 12 it should be comprehensive enough for them to follow the instructions.
customer_reviews.author: Amanda

customer_reviews.title: but I wouldn't recommend this for kids younger than 7
customer_reviews.text: This set is lots of very small pieces. My son loves it, but I wouldn't recommend this for kids younger than 7, unless they're already good with Technic sets.
customer_reviews.author: Rahul Pawa

customer_reviews.title: Lego Kit
customer_reviews.text: A gift for my five year old grandson who loved it and then proceeded to put it together within 24 hours.
customer_reviews.author: audrey lanier

customer_reviews.title: This is an awesome set
customer_reviews.text: This is an awesome set. Really wish more LEGO sets were this cool.
customer_reviews.author: archshrk

customer_reviews.title: Very intricate!
customer_reviews.text: Really fun build and relatively strong. The decorative pieces on the shoulders fall off easily but it's not that big of a deal.
customer_reviews.author: J. Bennett

customer_reviews.title: It's really fragile
customer_reviews.text: It's really fragile so when my kid plays with it, it falls apart.
customer_reviews.author: Bryan

customer_reviews.title: Fun set
customer_reviews.text: Love the minifigs and turtle! The suit is cool too and you can put any minifig in it. But its very fragile, so it limits the play factor. I like it though.
customer_reviews.author: JediMasterbuilder

customer_reviews.title: Amazing set!
customer_reviews.text: This is my first "Ideas" set, and it's really a weird one. The building process it's a fusion of techniques, and the final product is just spectacular!
customer_reviews.author: Pascualino Milazzo

customer_reviews.title: Amazeballs
customer_reviews.text: It is amazing. Please, Lego, release Peter Reid's other creations!
customer_reviews.author: Jeffrey D. Yoders

customer_reviews.title: Awesome!
customer_reviews.text: An amazing set that includes pieces I've been searching for for years!
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Five Stars
customer_reviews.text: my bf (who is 27) love's it! it was a must have for his set!
customer_reviews.author: amanda

customer_reviews.title: It is pretty awesome. This is the only set that I ...
customer_reviews.text: This set is 350 pieces of clips and tiny pieces. It is pretty awesome. This is the only set that I have kragled. Flimsy before but very sturdy after the glue!
customer_reviews.author: emillindable

customer_reviews.title: Four Stars
customer_reviews.text: Lot's of very small pieces so it might not be for younger kids.
customer_reviews.author: lpeters82

customer_reviews.title: Great set!
customer_reviews.text: Purchased two of the Exo Suit sets (one for me, one for my 7 year old son). We both built them together, side by side! Very unique set that looks great displayed in his bedroom and my office.
customer_reviews.author: Tender

customer_reviews.title: Five Stars
customer_reviews.text: Great fun, and lots of interesting parts. Something different, for when rocket ships and cars get old.
customer_reviews.author: BAndrews

customer_reviews.title: Beautiful Fun
customer_reviews.text: This is one of the most satisfying toys I've ever built. It wasn't too difficult to get put together and leaves me wanting to explore other similar designs. This is a great set for a patient kid whatever their age.
customer_reviews.author: D. Bonilla

customer_reviews.title: Good entertainment.
customer_reviews.text: My husband and I spend about an hour to build it. Good entertainment.
customer_reviews.author: hellomai

customer_reviews.title: Four Stars
customer_reviews.text: Just what my 10 year old son wanted. No surprises.
customer_reviews.author: LJ Sierra

customer_reviews.title: Four Stars
customer_reviews.text: Lego kit is really nice and got a great deal on this item.
customer_reviews.author: Radek Shadoobie

customer_reviews.title: Alien suite for my lego minifig!
customer_reviews.text: bought 2 one for display and the other for investment. will be worth more later one.
customer_reviews.author: MacPro

customer_reviews.title: This is a great value. Really fun to build
customer_reviews.text: This is a great value. Really fun to build, so many cool details. I'm considering getting a second set just so I can have more of all the cool pieces.
customer_reviews.author: Kyle Keifman

customer_reviews.title: Five Stars
customer_reviews.text: Fun kit, which is definitely a bit fragile. One has to be a bit cautious when playing with it.
customer_reviews.author: DCH2

customer_reviews.title: loved building it
customer_reviews.text: Most detailed lego set I've ever bought, loved building it.
customer_reviews.author: Steve

customer_reviews.title: Five Stars
customer_reviews.text: excelent product by lego, delivered in excelent shape and speed, good price
customer_reviews.author: whywuducare

customer_reviews.title: Five Stars
customer_reviews.text: Extreme detail and flexibility makes this guy an amazing build
customer_reviews.author: Dylan Westvig

customer_reviews.title: Great showpiece
customer_reviews.text: A fantastic showpiece. Fun to build with lots of different techniques used to piece it together. But this isn't meant to be played with much, as it is very fragile.
customer_reviews.author: J. Neville

customer_reviews.title: Usual excellence
customer_reviews.text: If you're used to LEGOs and are aware of what you're purchasing, this will be everything you hoped for. If you're unfamiliar with LEGO pricing vs product or think you are buying a children's toy, you will be disappointed.
customer_reviews.author: Aaron Greenspan

customer_reviews.title: Not opening
customer_reviews.text: This is a Lego idea and it is staying in the box
customer_reviews.author: Becky Turple

customer_reviews.title: Great LEGO set
customer_reviews.text: Great LEGO set. Fun to build and really interesting use of pieces. And of course, love the Green Space man. :)
customer_reviews.author: gene

customer_reviews.title: Exo Suit is fabulous!
customer_reviews.text: My grandson loves it! It is a true, wonderful LEGO specialty.
customer_reviews.author: Betty Leverton

customer_reviews.title: Great Service
customer_reviews.text: The product was exactly what the listing explained. Price was correct. Product was in mint condition. Shipping delivery prompt.
customer_reviews.author: NY Collector

customer_reviews.title: Cool for mature and adult builders, not so much for kids.
customer_reviews.text: This set is really cool. It was a fun build. However, it seems it wasn't intended to be played with. I built it andy son asked to play with (after waiting a little bit). Of course I obliged, it's a toy. It basically fell apart without much force. At least that's what he said but how much force does a 7 year old have? Anyways I think it said 12 and up but I couldn't deny a toy to my son. Like my title says, for mature and adult builders. Otherwise I would of gave it a 5.
customer_reviews.author: rikaneeze

customer_reviews.title: Great Lego Model
customer_reviews.text: Overall, it's a great model. Stands on its own two feet very well. Only criticism on the design is that the cockpit cage doesn't lock into place at the top of the exosuit, but it will move freely open or closed from the hinges on the front.
customer_reviews.author: Joshua Perry

customer_reviews.title: Have you got it yet???? Do it NOW!!!!!!
customer_reviews.text: Awesome!!!! Awesome!!!! Awesome!!!! If you haven't got this yet do it now!!!!!!! They will only be around for a while so get it while you can. What else do I need to say, it is a lego Mech suit, freaking awesom!!!
customer_reviews.author: Ben

customer_reviews.title: To be the Best you gotta BEAT THE BEST!
customer_reviews.text: This seller is the BEST, the Stylin', profilin', limousine riding, jet flying, kiss-stealing, wheelin' n' dealin' son of a gun! WOOOOOOOOOOOOOOOOOOOOOOOOOOOOOOOOOOOOOOOOOOOOOOOOOOO!
customer_reviews.author: SpyMagician

customer_reviews.title: My Grandson Loves These
customer_reviews.text: You can't go wrong with Legos. I don't play with them, my eight-year-old grandson does. This was a Christmas present and my daughter tells me he still plays with them.
customer_reviews.author: Wendy Perez

customer_reviews.title: Four Stars
customer_reviews.text: It's a really cool set. I would recommend it to any space fan. It comes with the classic green space minifigs. I wish I have other set like NASA Mars science laboratory curiosity rover and Hayabusa.
customer_reviews.author: Lego Lover

customer_reviews.title: A little more complex than some other kits, with ...
customer_reviews.text: A little more complex than some other kits, with lots of non-standard parts... which is ok... unless there are pieces missing; and there are. :(
customer_reviews.author: Pge

customer_reviews.title: great, Thank you.
customer_reviews.text: Perfect...it is another long term investment for us. Packed away.
customer_reviews.author: jlp

customer_reviews.title: tiny grey parts to hunt for, in a sea of tiny grey parts
customer_reviews.text: Nothing really wrong with this - it's Lego, it's fine - I just wanted to point out that it's a whole lot of grey tiny parts. For me, this was the least fun Lego set I've built, just from having to hunt for all the tiny grey parts in the sea of grey. Obviously, not everyone is bothered by that - just pointing it out in case you are. (I preferred building the mech in the Ninjago Temple of Light set.)
customer_reviews.author: imdebra

customer_reviews.title: Looks nice, plays poorly.
customer_reviews.text: There's a keen difference between a *model* and a *toy*. This is a model: it's fine if you pose it carefully and then LEAVE IT ALONE. It's not fine if you actually want to play with it. The wrist-arm-shoulder articulation is wonky, and there are a number of poorly secured decorative bits. The Pete and Yves minifigs are great, and the robo-turtle is a lot of fun! On the other hand, The Exo Suit is sitting in a bowl on my project table reduced to pieces. At least it gives me a bunch of small technic parts!
customer_reviews.author: Stephen Shipman

customer_reviews.title: Great set
customer_reviews.text: My husband bought this for himself but allowed our 6yo son to assemble it. It's a really cool set, and our kids all are quite impressed.
customer_reviews.author: LawWife

customer_reviews.title: Makes a great desk model though
customer_reviews.text: It's an indescribably detailed set. Not much for play though as it is very fragile. Makes a great desk model though.
customer_reviews.author: Robert Schaefer

customer_reviews.title: Five Stars
customer_reviews.text: Easily my favorite Lego that doesn't cost a ridiculous amount
customer_reviews.author: shleeve

customer_reviews.title: Five Stars
customer_reviews.text: My grandson was very excited to receive the Exo Suit Legos
customer_reviews.author: Gina Fitts

customer_reviews.title: Amazon and Lego are excellent!!!!
customer_reviews.text: Both are the best company on the earth with their service and products quality. Hope to buy from Amazon again. This exosuit is perfect. I would like to give 10/10!!!
customer_reviews.author: Kathrine C

customer_reviews.title: Still thinking to get this?
customer_reviews.text: Speechlessness. It definitely deserves 5 stars. Just buy it before it becomes a retired product.
customer_reviews.author: vaio1

customer_reviews.title: amazing
customer_reviews.text: lengthy, challenging build took me two sittings. more suited to AFOL or child + adult. A conglomerate of the tiniest lego pieces available to form a model quite impressive. I felt like a kid again. Nothing beats the frustration of not being able to find a piece, coming to the conclusion that lego messed up and didn't include it, then discovering that you were sitting on it the entire time.
customer_reviews.author: ryan hartley

customer_reviews.title: Fun little lego set
customer_reviews.text: Great enjoyable lego set, lots of little pieces but a fun build and highly posable, ended up buying two, and considering that it's retired, $30 was a pretty good deal. Probably not suited for a little kid, but any kid with lego experience or any adult who can follow instructions even if no lego experience should be able to figure it out.
customer_reviews.author: James

product_meta.title: LEGO Ideas Exo Suit 21109
product_meta.description: Put on your spacesuit and head out with Pete, Yves and their robot turtle on a mission to discover the long-lost Exo Suit! Selected by LEGO Ideas members (formerly known as CUUSOO), this amazing model first appeared in the unofficial book, LEGO Space, written by LEGO fan and builder, Peter Reid. Featuring posable limbs, opening cockpit, grabbing claws and an intricate, modular form that you can tune to suit the most challenging missions, this amazing Exo Suit captures the essence of Classic Space design - and for the first time in 30 years, we've kitted Pete and Yves out in green spacesuits with the Classic Space logo! This set also includes building instructions and a fun booklet containing a cool space-themed story featuring the models and from the set, plus information about the creator. Includes 2 astronaut .
feature_bullets: Build the model voted for by LEGO Ideas members! Includes Pete and Yves astronaut mini figures,Robot turtle also included
Exo Suit features poseable limbs, opening cockpit, grabbing claws and a modular design, Includes spacesuits in green with Classic Space logo!
Discover the long-lost Exo Suit! Tune the Exo Suit to suit your own space exploration missions!
The perfect gift for fans of LEGO bricks and space adventurers of all ages! Includes booklet with story and information about the creator
Stands over 8" (22cm) tall with antenna extended
